dt: {bc}to produce musical tones by means of the voice
{bc}to utter words in musical tones and with musical inflections and modulations
{bc}to deliver songs as a trained or professional {a_link|singer}
{bc}to make a shrill whining or whistling sound
{bc}to relate or celebrate something in verse
{bc}to create in or through words a feeling or sense of song
{bc}to interpret in musical tones produced by the voice
{bc}to bring or accompany to a place or state by {a_link|singing}

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}singan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}singan{/it} to sing, Greek {it}omphē{/it} voice
shortdef: to produce musical tones by means of the voice
to utter words in musical tones and with musical inflections and modulations
to deliver songs as a trained or professional singer

cxs.cxl: past tense and past participle of

dt: {bc}an informal session of group singing of popular or folk songs {bc}{sx|songfest||}

dt.t: People who had brought their guitars led spontaneous {wi}sing-alongs{/wi} in the hotel lobby.
Old-fashioned hayrides and {wi}sing-alongs{/wi} in front of a campfire …
Audience participation is one of the things that has made the show a success, and there will, again, be plenty of opportunity to take part in the {wi}sing-alongs{/wi}.
A guy from the wedding party joined the band for the Garth Brooks classic {wi}sing-along{/wi} {ldquo}Friends in Low Places{rdquo} and knocked it out of the park.

shortdef: an informal session of group singing of popular or folk songs : songfest; also : a song appropriate for a sing-along

dt: {bc}to change the way one talks about something {bc}to have a different opinion about something

dt.t: They say they're not worried about money, but once they see how much the new equipment will cost, they'll be {it}singing a different tune{/it}.

shortdef: to change the way one talks about something : to have a different opinion about something

dt: {bc}to speak or write about (someone or something) especially with enthusiasm

dt.t: The poet {it}sang of{/it} knights and medieval times.

shortdef: to speak or write about (someone or something) especially with enthusiasm

dt.t: If you need any help, just {it}sing out{/it}.
The children {it}sang out{/it} "good morning" to the teacher.
The singer stopped and the crowd {it}sang out{/it} the rest of the chorus.

shortdef: to say or shout something loudly

dt: {bc}to say good things about someone or something often in a very enthusiastic way

dt.t: The doctor has a wonderful bedside manner and patients {it}sing her praises{/it}.
It seems like everyone is {it}singing the new restaurant's praises{/it}, but I was unimpressed.

shortdef: to say good things about someone or something often in a very enthusiastic way

dt: {bc}to say good things about someone or something often in a very enthusiastic way

dt.t: They were {it}singing the praises of{/it} their new equipment.
The critics {it}sang the praises of{/it} her performance in the play.

shortdef: to say good things about someone or something often in a very enthusiastic way
